ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: By taking this course, I greatly improved my fluency in Spanish. This course taught me all I needed to know to feel prepared to go forward in both my studies and everyday life at home as I speak to my family. Also, I learned more about my cultural heritage through our engagement with books, art, and film.

The class built upon the foundational lessons taught in the first term course. I gained further developed my grammar in Spanish, as well as expanded my vocabulary. The class also discussed important contemporary issues in Latin America and among Latinx communities. Overall, the course taught me how to utilize proper writing and speaking tools in Spanish and how to discuss a variety of topics in Spanish with minimal errors.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: The professor works with every student to improve their Spanish ability; you interact a lot with your classmates and really feel like a family at the end; assignments are interesting and engaging
Weaknesses: Can't think of any

Strengths: the professor was extremely responsive to the needs to the class, there was a strong sense of community among the class, the professor was willing to discuss past lessons at great length in order to ensure that students understood the material. Weaknesses: Canvas assignments (specifically assignments in quiz format) made receiving feedback difficult (e.g. sometimes the right answer would appear after an assignment/quiz was completed, but no explanation was given for that answer.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Our professor was incredible at creating interactive breakout room assignments that were productive and did not feel awkward!

Succeeded: breakout rooms with the instructor visiting each of the individual groups, the semester-long timeline project that kept students engaged throughout the term. Could be improved: assignments and quizzes automatically graded by Canvas, since only the right answer is occasionally shown, but no explanation is given for that answer.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: YES ONE HUNDRED PERCENT! If you feel like Spanish proficiency isn't where it needs to be, please take this course! It will help you feel confident in your skills by the end, and you will enjoy every moment of the course.

Yes, I would strongly recommend this course to any student that already has a background in Spanish or is from Hispanic heritage, as the course will address the mistakes you are making, while helping to expand your overall speaking and writing abilities.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
